resources.string: Or provide more data for a custom likelihood that you are already \'infected\':
You may or may not be infected. We don\'t reveal this yet. Now touch a phone.
Female are more likely to get HIV
In Africa HIV is most prevealed

Try this Android app I found for World AIDS Day: HIV Awareness\n\nSearch in the Android Market for \'HIV Awareness\' or open http://market.android.com/search?q=pname:net.lp.hivawareness in your phone\'s browser.
Try this Android app I found: HIV Awareness

HIV Awareness is still in beta. It simulates HIV infection with exaggerated probabilities from the real world, where touching two phones is the 'deed'. 

Touch another phone with NFC capabilities and start with the global average probability, or set your custom probability first by providing data. 

This probability represents the chance you already have HIV today and initializes you as part of our virtual base population. When interacting with others, we use other likelihoods of passing on - or getting passed on - the infection (when present). Only one device can infect the other. 

Only after 5 interactions do we reveal if you had/have HIV. Purpose is to work out an app that can playfully create awareness about the still present dangers of inadequate protection against HIV.
Feels good huh? Enjoy the cigarette.
We don\'t reveal yet whether you were infected.
